thread.title: H.S. football: Cresskill gets past Park Ridge, 18-15
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Cresskill gets past Park Ridge, 18-15

title: H.S. football: Cresskill gets past Park Ridge, 18-15
text:
PARK RIDGE - Cresskill Cougars head coach Kevin Quinn told the players after the Oct. 16 game, "Last week we needed a yard and I didn't put faith in the guys to get it. 
"I was not going to do it again." 
Senior running back Brendan Coffey rewarded Quinn by scoring his third touchdown of the game, a 1-yard plunge with three seconds remaining in the game lifting the Cougars (4-2) past the Park Ridge Owls (5-1), 18-15, at Doc Lewis Field in Park Ridge. 
Coffey carried the ball 36 times for 199 yards, with 139 coming in the second half. 
'MUST-WIN' 
After the Owls went up 15-12 with 9:43 left in the fourth quarter, Coffey gave the Cougars great starting field position by returning the ensuing kickoff to the 38-yard line. 
Then Coffey ran the ball on 12-of-20 plays of the 62-yard drive that chewed up 9:26 of the clock. 
Along the way the Cougars faced a 4th-and-2 at the Park Ridge 26-yard line and Coffey churned ahead for four yards. The next big play was a 4th-and-inches at the Owls 12 and junior quarterback Jack Maltby dove ahead for the first down. 
Ultimately it all came down to 4th-and-2 at the 4-yard line with 16 seconds remaining and Coffey barreled ahead for three yards to set up 1st-and-goal at the 1-yard line. 
"Coming into this game we were out of the playoffs and seeded ninth," said Coffey. "We knew it was a must-win and power points were on the line. I have so much faith in our line which kept driving and getting first down after first down and ran out the clock." 
CONTROLLING THE BALL 
After a scoreless first quarter Park Ridge took over at its own 32-yard line after a Cougars punt. Hall ripped off runs of eight and 16 yards and Matthews fired a 26-yard pass to Gabriel Robles to move the ball down to the 16. 
Hall gained eight more yards, setting up 2nd-and-2 at the 8-yard line. Matthews appeared to have scored on an 8-yard run but a holding penalty negated the touchdown. 
Cresskill's defense clamped down forcing Matthews into an incomplete pass and stuffing him for no gain on a keeper. The Owls attempted a field goal but the kick sailed wide left. 
"We were able to get a couple of stops and caught a break on a couple of incomplete passes and the missed field goal," said Quinn. "We knew they would be able to move the ball down the field a little bit so we had to control the ball and clock and keep the ball out of their hands." 
COUGARS SCORE FIRST 
Taking over at the 20-yard line with 10:03 left in the second quarter, Park Ridge was signaled for a personal foul facemask penalty moving the ball up to the 48-yard line. Maltby completed a 13-yard pass to Daniel Garzino which brought the ball to the Owls 34. Nick Carroll added a 13-yard run while Coffey gained four yards on a 3rd-and-2 at the Park Ridge 7. 
From there Coffey blasted through the hole for the score. But the extra point failed so the Cougars led, 6-0 
Owls junior running back Ray Tomatsu returned the ensuing kickoff to the 26-yard line. On a 3rd-and-11 from the Park Ridge 24, Matthews aired out a 27-yard pass to Robles. A pass interference call against the Cougars defense kept the drive alive for Park Ridge. The Owls cashed in on a 2nd-and-10 at the Cresskill 15 as Matthews hooked up with Joshua Lewis on the touchdown and Kurt Nixdorf drilled the extra point making it 7-6. 
ANSWERING BACK 
The two teams exchanged punts to start the second half, and then the Cougars wasted little time jumping ahead as Coffey busted through a hole and scampered down the left sidelines for a 76-yard touchdown.
